page.title: 09EDUCATION:STUDENT STATISTICS
page.content: In 1985 this area has a total {student population of 3689}dominated by the{state system,}but between the Wars, Bexhill was noted for its large number of{independent schools.}The last two are shortly to be merged, and are both{girls' public boarding {schools,}totaling 361 pupils. Here also is sited Bexhill's{6th Form {College}of 450, inauguarated in 1976, and a{co-ed state Secondary School}of 1450 which feeds into the college.{6 {state Primary Schools}totalling 1251 pupils, 2 co-ed{Special schools}of 121 pupils and 1 independent girls' primary of 56 complete the list. The private and one special school are sited in Victorian buildings. The college was previously a{grammar {school}built in 1926. The primary schools have a 1 mile catchment area; the college covers a 20 mile radius.
